name: Desvenlafaxine

dosing.notes: Active metabolite of venlafaxine; minimal benefit from doses >50 mg; take with or without food

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Can increase to 100 mg after 1 week if needed, but limited additional efficacy
canadian_clinical.max_dose_evidence: 100 mg/day (no additional benefit shown above 50 mg)
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 50 mg/day (most patients); 100 mg occasionally used but not recommended
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 50 mg daily; minimal need for titration
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: 50 mg once daily; reassess at 4-6 weeks; limited evidence for dose increases

warnings: Black box warning: Increased suicidal thinking in children/adolescents/young adults
Discontinuation syndrome - taper slowly despite shorter half-life than venlafaxine
Less drug interactions than venlafaxine (not metabolized by CYP2D6)
Minimal evidence for superiority over venlafaxine; more expensive

cautions.renal: CrCl 30-50: Max 50 mg/day; CrCl <30: Max 50 mg every other day or 25 mg/day
cautions.hepatic: Max 100 mg/day (no dose adjustment for mild-moderate); use caution in severe
